text:
Mailufterl is an Austrian nickname for the first computer working solely on transistors on the European mainland. It was built in 1955 at the Vienna University of Technology by Heinz Zemanek. The builder plays on a quote on an operating computer: "If it is not the will be enough for a Wiener Mailufterl'. The full name is Binar dezimaler Volltransistor-Rechenautomat.
Mmlu(kl is en AstrAn nicKrone fr Hi fi/s
Compvher noking sokely on tansisters on ffe
Compgher: "1Fif is nef the rapid glculahn speed of Ame'canmodels tHaf Whirl und or Tyhoon can achieve, if will Le enough fer a Weer Ma;li(fel.
The (vll name i5Binar deZimalrVollfransisfor  Reclen avtomt"
